meanings.definition: The condition of having an unusually vivid or perfect memory.
meanings.sent1: Her hypermnesias allowed her to remember every detail of her childhood birthday parties.
meanings.sent2: His hypermnesias helped him excel in school by recalling information effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The hypermnesias of the detective made solving the case a breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her hypermnesias were like a photographic memory, capturing every moment in perfect detail.
meanings.sent5: The hypermnesias of the historian were so accurate that they could recreate events as if they were happening again.

meanings.definition: The ability to recall past events with great detail and accuracy.
meanings.sent1: The hypermnesias of the elderly man allowed him to reminisce about his youth with clarity.
meanings.sent2: She relied on her hypermnesias to recount the events of the accident to the police.
meanings.sent3: His hypermnesias were so sharp that he could remember what he had for breakfast last Tuesday.
meanings.sent4: The hypermnesias of the witness were crucial in providing an accurate testimony in court.
meanings.sent5: The hypermnesias of the author brought the historical novel to life with vivid descriptions.
